issue.title: [CF 539] Random error 2
issue.body:
Error occured in: Global
Count: 1
Message: ...MeWhen\Lib\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0.lua line 223:
   attempt to index local 'guidToUnits_oldGuid' (a nil value)
Debug:
   [C]: ?
   ...MeWhen\Lib\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0.lua:223:
      ...MeWhen\Lib\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0.lua:214
   ...MeWhen\Lib\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0\LibDogTag-Unit-3.0.lua:428: func()
   ...rface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Lib\LibDogTag-3.0\Events.lua:271:
      ...rface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Lib\LibDogTag-3.0\Events.lua:264

Do you mind if I keep naming these benign errors in this fashion? Again, nothing happened. I think I got this message upon login, but now I'm not sure anymore. Occured on live using r544.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #539 | Raw

comments.body:
Best naming scheme would be something like:

LibDogTag-Unit-3.0.lua line 223: attempt to index local 'guidToUnits_oldGuid' (a nil value)

or

ERROR: LibDogTag-Unit-3.0.lua line 223

if the error string is really really long.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I've pretty much made myself an unofficial dev for DogTag, so this shouldn't be too hard to fix.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Hacked in a fix. Not sure if the fix will work, or if it will break other things. We will see, I suppose.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
